results.title: Scientific and medical research
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
An overview of current scientific and medical research in Australia. Looks briefly at space tracking stations, interscan, solar energy, medical technology, nuclear medicine, microsurgery and the invitro fertilisation program. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Culture and recreation
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
A non-narrated montage of images showing aspects of culture and recreation in Australia, interspersed with some historic footage. Shows sport, dance, historic buildings, the Sydney Opera House, opera performances and festivals. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Scramble
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Children's Film Foundation and Eady-Barnes Productions
results.brief_description: Jimmy has been in trouble with the police. He is befriended by a group who invite him to join the local Motorcycle Scramble Club. Jimmy and his friends become involved with a couple of crooks who attempt to sabotage the club’s chances of winning. Rated: G (

results.title: Mining
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
A detailed statement of Australia’s massive mining developments in the eighties - tin, coal, bauxite, iron ore as well as the production of the more rare metals such as gold, silver and uranium. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Scouts: the rise of the world scouting movement
results.creator_credit: Michael Dana Murphy and Clear Horizon Films
results.brief_description: Scouts is a celebration of the potential of youth that documents the triumphs and tragedies of the Scout ideal. Historic newsreels, rare archival film and scenes from Baden-Powell’s own home movies bring alive the era of Baden-Powell and the origins of Scouting. “Scouts” is a unique program that will captivate any audience, whether or not they have taken the Scout oath.

results.title: Screens and screams
results.brief_description: Kids’ Own Publishing Partnership will have a series of workshops and resultant exhibition which aims : to promote reading including visual literacy, to engage children in the creative process of working together towards a shared outcome, to produce a number of digital stories, to stimulate publishing in schools beyond the boundaries of the project, to extend children’s experience as readers and writers and illustrators.

results.title: Commerce
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia in the 80’s”.
A look at Australia’s image within the world of commerce in the 1980’s - its transportation, stock exchanges, futures markets, and its growth in the cattle, produce and minerals industries. Suitable for lower secondary level.

group_siblings.title: Screens and screams [the movie]
group_siblings.creator_credit: ACMI

results.title: Screens and screams [the movie]
results.brief_description: In October 2002, just before opening at Federation Square, ACMI and the City of Melbourne asked the Kids Own Publishing Partnership from Ireland to run a workshop for over 300 primary school students from 8 schools in the city. Each group of kids had a different job to do - some made and filmed shadow puppets, some acted, some digitally animated, and some created an original soundtrack with artists from the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra. The result was the very first Made @ACMI student movie ‘Screens and Screams’
